metadata.name: Hub Networking
metadata.description: This module is designed to simplify the creation of multi-region hub networks in Azure. It will create a number of virtual networks and subnets, and optionally peer them together in a mesh topology with routing.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.value.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.value.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.value.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The name of the virtual network.
Required. The address prefixes for the virtual network.
Optional. The Azure Firewall config.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Enable/Disable Azure Bastion for the virtual network.
Optional. Enable/Disable Azure Firewall for the virtual network.
Optional. The location of the virtual network. Defaults to the location of the resource group.
Optional. The lock settings of the virtual network.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the virtual network.
Optional. The DDoS protection plan resource ID.
Optional. The DNS servers of the virtual network.
Optional. The flow timeout in minutes.
Optional. Enable/Disable peering for the virtual network.
Optional. The peerings of the virtual network.
Optional. The role assignments to create.
Optional. Routes to add to the virtual network route table.
Optional. The subnets of the virtual network.
Optional. The tags of the virtual network.
Optional. Enable/Disable VNet encryption.
Optional. The VNet encryption enforcement settings of the virtual network.
Optional. The peerings of the virtual network.
Optional. Hub IP addresses.
Optional. Virtual Hub ID.
Optional. Additional public IP configurations.
Optional. Application rule collections.
Optional. Azure Firewall SKU.
Optional. Diagnostic settings.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Firewall policy ID.
Optional. The location of the virtual network. Defaults to the location of the resource group.
Optional. Lock settings.
Optional. Management IP address configuration.
Optional. Management IP resource ID.
Optional. NAT rule collections.
Optional. Network rule collections.
Optional. Public IP address object.
Optional. Public IP resource ID.
Optional. Role assignments.
Optional. Tags.
Optional. Threat Intel mode.
Optional. Zones.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. A map of the hub virtual networks to create.

metadata.name: Virtual Networks
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllLogs' to collect all logs.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllMetrics' to collect all metrics.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to '' to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The Virtual Network (vNet) Name.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Required. An Array of 1 or more IP Address Prefixes for the Virtual Network.
Optional. An Array of subnets to deploy to the Virtual Network.
Optional. DNS Servers associated to the Virtual Network.

Optional. Resource ID of the DDoS protection plan to assign the VNET to. If it's left blank, DDoS protection will not be configured. If it's provided, the VNET created by this template will be attached to the referenced DDoS protection plan. The DDoS protection plan can exist in the same or in a different subscription.
Optional. Virtual Network Peerings configurations.

Optional. Indicates if encryption is enabled on virtual network and if VM without encryption is allowed in encrypted VNet. Requires the EnableVNetEncryption feature to be registered for the subscription and a supported region to use this property.
Optional. If the encrypted VNet allows VM that does not support encryption. Can only be used when vnetEncryption is enabled.

Optional. The flow timeout in minutes for the Virtual Network, which is used to enable connection tracking for intra-VM flows. Possible values are between 4 and 30 minutes. Default value 0 will set the property to null.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Virtual Network Subnets
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Subnet.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The Name of the subnet resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent virtual network. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The address prefix for the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the network security group to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the route table to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The service endpoints to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The delegations to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the NAT Gateway to use for the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private endpoint in the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
Optional. List of address prefixes for the subnet.
Optional. Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Optional. Array of IpAllocation which reference this subnet.
Optional. An array of service endpoint policies.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.
The address prefix for the subnet.
List of address prefixes for the subnet.

metadata.name: Virtual Network Peerings
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Peering.
Optional. The Name of Vnet Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Conditional. The name of the parent Virtual Network to add the peering to. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. If we need to verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.

metadata.name: Virtual Network Peerings
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Peering.
Optional. The Name of Vnet Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Conditional. The name of the parent Virtual Network to add the peering to. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. If we need to verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.
The resource group the virtual network was deployed into.
The resource ID of the virtual network.
The name of the virtual network.
The names of the deployed subnets.
The resource IDs of the deployed subnets.
The location the resource was deployed into.

Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Required. Name of the route.
Required. The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to.
Optional. The destination CIDR to which the route applies.
Optional. A value indicating whether this route overrides overlapping BGP routes regardless of LPM.
Optional. The IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is VirtualAppliance.
Required. Properties of the route.
Required. Name given for the hub route table.

metadata.name: Public IP Addresses
metadata.description: This module deploys a Public IP Address.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.

Required. The domain name label scope. If a domain name label and a domain name label scope are specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system with a hashed value includes in FQDN.
Optional. The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.

Optional. The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.
Required. The DDoS protection plan ID associated with the public IP address.
Required. The DDoS protection policy customizations.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The name of the Public IP Address.
Optional. Resource ID of the Public IP Prefix object. This is only needed if you want your Public IPs created in a PIP Prefix.
Optional. The public IP address allocation method.
Optional. A list of availability zones denoting the IP allocated for the resource needs to come from.
Optional. IP address version.
Optional. The DNS settings of the public IP address.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Name of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. Tier of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. The DDoS protection plan configuration associated with the public IP address.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The idle timeout of the public IP address.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.

metadata.name: Azure Firewalls
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Firewall.

Conditional. Shared services Virtual Network resource ID. The virtual network ID containing AzureFirewallSubnet. If a Public IP is not provided, then the Public IP that is created as part of this module will be applied with the subnet provided in this variable. Required if `virtualHubId` is empty.
Optional. The Public IP resource ID to associate to the AzureFirewallSubnet. If empty, then the Public IP that is created as part of this module will be applied to the AzureFirewallSubnet.
Optional. This is to add any additional Public IP configurations on top of the Public IP with subnet IP configuration.
Optional. Specifies the properties of the Public IP to create and be used by the Firewall, if no existing public IP was provided.

Optional. The Management Public IP resource ID to associate to the AzureFirewallManagementSubnet. If empty, then the Management Public IP that is created as part of this module will be applied to the AzureFirewallManagementSubnet.

Optional. Specifies the properties of the Management Public IP to create and be used by Azure Firewall. If it's not provided and managementIPResourceID is empty, a '-mip' suffix will be appended to the Firewall's name.
Optional. Collection of application rule collections used by Azure Firewall.
Optional. Collection of network rule collections used by Azure Firewall.
Optional. Collection of NAT rule collections used by Azure Firewall.
Optional. Resource ID of the Firewall Policy that should be attached.
Conditional. IP addresses associated with AzureFirewall. Required if `virtualHubId` is supplied.
Conditional. The virtualHub resource ID to which the firewall belongs. Required if `virtualNetworkId` is empty.
Optional. The operation mode for Threat Intel.
Optional. Zone numbers e.g. 1,2,3.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the Azure Firewall resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

reference('managementIPAddress').outputs.resourceId.value))), createObject()))), null()), 'sku', createObject('name', variables('azureSkuName'), 'tier', parameters('azureSkuTier')), properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Public IP Addresses
metadata.description: This module deploys a Public IP Address.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.

Required. The domain name label scope. If a domain name label and a domain name label scope are specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system with a hashed value includes in FQDN.
Optional. The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.

Optional. The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.
Required. The DDoS protection plan ID associated with the public IP address.
Required. The DDoS protection policy customizations.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The name of the Public IP Address.
Optional. Resource ID of the Public IP Prefix object. This is only needed if you want your Public IPs created in a PIP Prefix.
Optional. The public IP address allocation method.
Optional. A list of availability zones denoting the IP allocated for the resource needs to come from.
Optional. IP address version.
Optional. The DNS settings of the public IP address.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Name of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. Tier of a public IP address SKU.
Optional. The DDoS protection plan configuration associated with the public IP address.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The idle timeout of the public IP address.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: The resource group the public IP address was deployed into.
The name of the public IP address.
The resource ID of the public IP address.
The public IP address of the public IP address resource.
The location the resource was deployed into.

parameters.name: [if(contains(parameters('managementIPAddressObject'), 'name'), if(not(empty(parameters('managementIPAddressObject').name)), createObject('value', parameters('managementIPAddressObject').name), createObject('value', format('{0}-mip', parameters('name')))), createObject('value', format('{0}-mip', parameters('name'))))]
